content.data: Report Groups may be created to contain Reports that are similar to each other OR Report Groups could be created to contain all Reports needed for a certain type of Job.
When you click Setup Reports, you will see the following screen:

This is a list of the Reports that are available in the S2M CENTER. In the sidebar is a list of all of the Report Groups that have been created.  To create a new report group, simply click the Add button  and then enter the name that you want to use for this group. When you click OK the new group will be added to the list of Report Groups.

After you have created your new Report Group, you will need to begin assigning Reports to that Group. To add a Report to a Group, click on that Report and then click the check box to add a check next to the desired Report Group. As you scroll down the right side of your screen you will notice that some of the Reports have a green S2M icon in front of them. This green S2M icon lets you know that the Report has been assigned to a Group. If you click on that Report you will see a check mark next to one or more of the Report "Groups" in the sidebar. Reports can be assigned to more than one group if you like.
/   Adding a Report to a Group

To add a Report to a Group click on the Report you would like to add to a Group, so that it is highlighted. Then in the "Groups" window click on the check box next to the name of the Group you would like to add the highlighted Report to. Once added the Report icon will either be   or  .
/   Removing a Report from a Group

To remove a Report from a Group click on that Report, so that it is highlighted. Then in the "Groups" window, click on the check box next to the name of the Group you would like to remove the highlighted Report from, to remove the Report remove the check mark. Once removed from all Groups the Report icon will either be   or  .

Before adding a Report to a Report Group, you may wish to preview that Report to determine whether it is the correct format for your needs. To preview a Report, simply click on that Report and then click the View Mode option in the Report Mode drop-down. As a preview of the Report, you will see a the Report with the information from the current Job.
Only active in View Mode this option allows you to Zoom In and Out on the Preview.
This ribbonoption opens the Report Editor. See the Report Editor Help file for more information. The Report Editor Help file is accessible via the help button at the top right as illustrated below.

This option allows you to edit the Name, Description, and source data for the selected Report. You can also determine if the Report needs a Part Graphic (including Type and Size), the Banding Symbol Size, and whether to display Part Sizes and Part Names (For Pattern Printouts).
Will Copy the selected Report giving you the ability to give it a new Title and Description.
Will Delete the selected Report. Only available for User Reports.
Will Copy the selected Report giving you the ability to give it a new Title and Description.
Will Delete the selected Report. Only available for User Reports.
Will Open the selected Report in the Report Editor. If it is a System Report you will be prompted to Copy the Report first as System Reports can not be edited directly.
Opens the Report Properties utility allowing you to change the Title, Description, and/or source data of the selected Report.
The S2M Center comes with the following predefined reports, simply select the report from the sidebar you would like to view.

Material summary that groups the sheets used in this run by the material name, then provides a breakout of the sheet sizes used.
This is a recreation of the old nested cut list from previous versions.
This is a recreation of the old nested cut list from previous versions rotated to the Landscape position.
Nest Cut List - Large Format - NEST09
This is a simple cut list that shows the part name, size, and comment.
Nest Cut List - Simple Landscape - NEST06
This is a simple cut list that shows the part name, size, and comment rotated for the Landscape position.
Nest cut list with more information than the legacy cut list.
Nest Cut List Extended - Landscape - NEST04
Nest cut list with more information than the legacy cut list rotated for Landscape position.
Nest Pattern - Large Format NPN - NPLF02
Large format nest pattern sheet, part width, part length, and part number. Two sheets for page.
Nest Pattern - Large Format PN - NPLF01
Large format nest pattern sheet, part width, part length, part number, and part name. Two sheets for page.
This is a list of all of the primary programs generated for the job.
Nest Program List w/ Picture NEST08
This is a list of all of the primary programs generated for the job, provides a picture of the nest as well as the barcodes.
List of the outline tools assigned to each material per machine.
Part list with programs, grouped by cabinet
Part list with programs, grouped by material
Part list with programs, grouped by part description
Part list with programs, grouped by program
This is a recreation of the old part printouts from previous versions
This is a recreation of the old part printouts from previous versions rotated for Landscape Position
Displays an image of the part with a list of all operations assigned to it.
Displays an image of the part with a list of all operations assigned to it, rotated for Landscape position.
Part program list, grouped by cabinet
Part program list, grouped by material
Part program list, grouped by part description
Part program list, grouped by program

This is a recreation of the old saw cut list from previous versions.
This is a recreation of the old saw cut list from previous versions rotated to the Landscape position.
Saw Cut List - Large Format - SAW007
This is a simple cut list that shows the part name, size, and comment.
Saw Cut List - Simple Landscape - SAW006
This is a simple cut list that shows the part name, size, and comment rotated for Landscape position.
Saw cut list with more information than the legacy cut list.
Saw Cut List Extended - Landscape - SAW004
Saw cut list with more information than the legacy cut list rotated for the Landscape position.
Saw Optimization - Large Format NPN - SOLF02
Large format saw optimization sheet, part width, part length, and part number. Two sheets for page.
Saw Optimization - Large Format PN - SOLF01
Large format saw optimization sheet, part width, part length, part number, and part name. Two sheets for page..
Part Labels for the Avery 4013 style label. This report outputs a label for each machine that the part has been output to in your machine set
Part Labels for the Avery 5366 style label. This report outputs a label for each machine that the part has been output to in your machine set

All existing part label reports have indicators on each part label which indicate if a part will run in a "normal" or "mirror" part machining "zone" ( M ) and, also, if the part has two part CNC programs ( 2nd ):
How to "read" the M and 2nd indicators:
Part on label has one part CNC program (that which is referenced on the part label) that will run in a "normal" part machining "zone".
Part on label has one part CNC program (that which is referenced on the part label) that will run in a "mirror" part machining "zone".

Part on label has two part CNC programs. The part CNC program which is referenced on the part label itself will run in a "normal" part machining "zone." The second part CNC program (referenced implicitly) will run in a "mirror" part machining "zone" (opposite of that indicated for part CNC program referenced on the part label).

Part on label has two part CNC programs. The part CNC program which is referenced on the part label itself will run in a "mirror" part machining "zone." The second part CNC program (referenced implicitly) will run in a "normal" part machining "zone" (opposite of that indicated for part CNC program referenced on the part label).
In addition to this the name of the part program itself also indicates which Face the Program is output to machine.
F  - Front CNC program for operations machined from the part face (finished face  of material) (example: r01f0001)
B  - Back CNC program for operations machined from the part back (unfinished  face of material) (example: r01b0001)

All program list reports place an indicator ( M ) beside each part CNC program to be run in a "mirror" part machining "zone." Those part CNC programs lacking the ( M ) indicator are to be run in a "normal" part machining zone:
